intro: Galium namaquense, commonly known as theNamaqua silverweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite and have a silvery or grayish appearance, which helps reduce water loss in dry environments.
